page.title: 07Benfield Valley Plan (CONT)
page.content: pressing requirements.But the environmental case is also compelling. There are some sites for housing,and there will be more if the by-pass is built.There will never be another green wedge.Local residents do not accept that a link road is needed on the southern part of the golf course to provide access to Brighton Council land(known as the piggy bank).They believe that an improved Hangleton Lane is all that is needed.They also oppose selling Greenleas Recreation Ground for housing development even though Hove Council estimates that it could gain 1 million pounds from the sale.Many local people think that the Valley should be set aside for playing fields with a "green walkway" running from Old Shoreham Rd. up to the Downs & for facilities like a garden centre, riding centre or pavilions.
